text: long livers are great way to break up
long travel days and explore new cities
in this video I'm going to show you how
to maximize an 18-hour layover in
Beijing my way over here already this
year Americans and people from 53
countries are allowed to get a free 72
hour transit visa in most major Chinese
cities upon arrival only if you have
proof of an onward flight it's a great
way to see China without the hassle of
getting a visa here's a few tips if you
have a layover here give yourself extra
time Beijing Airport is so big that it
can take 45 minutes just to walk from
immigration to your gate the security
check is very strict
all cameras power banks hard drives and
every tiny liquid must come out or else
they will shamelessly empty out your bag
in my previous layover in Beijing I've
made trips to the Great Wall of China
indulge in authentic cuisine and
prepared for my trip to North Korea
today I'm heading to the Forbidden City
a UNESCO site with the largest
collection of ancient preserved wooden
structures in the world all these
incredible buildings were made from the
Ming Dynasty in 1420 to the end of the
Shang Dynasty in 1912 across the street
is Jana Minh square one of the largest
city squares in the world with several
monuments and political significance
such as a student protest in 1989 when
thousands of people were killed later in
the day I head to a soccer match in the
Chinese Premier League which was a lot
rowdier than I expected
it was also hilarious to bargain for the
ticket from Gaza street to cap off a
great day Chinese food and drinks and
that's how you maximize a layover in
Beijing what's your best layover
experience
I'm drew been ski and if you like my
travel videos please click Subscribe and
join me as I plan to visit every country
in the world
